pullRequest.title: [Transform] implement node.transform to control where to run a transform

closes #50033
closes #48734

nodes.bodyText: nit: two strings appended on same line could be made into a single string

It should return Settings.EMPTY here if enabled == false.
Same as ML does in 
  
    
      elasticsearch/x-pack/plugin/ml/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/ml/MachineLearning.java
    
    
         Line 463
      in
      0d1e67d
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return Settings.EMPTY;

I think this should only be checked for nodes that are on versions earlier than 7.7.
To match the documentation transforms should run on nodes that are defined as transform nodes, regardless of whether they are also data nodes.
And then since we didn't have transform nodes prior to 7.7 the BWC logic should be that pre-7.7 nodes are transform nodes if and only if they are data nodes.

I realised that in my previous review where I suggested not taking node.data into account in the assignment that this could cause a surprise to users who don't adjust their elasticsearch.yml after upgrading to 7.7, because it would mean transforms would start running on all types of nodes instead of just data nodes.
So an additional change I would suggest to prevent this is that the default value of node.transform be xpack.transform.enabled && node.data.  In other words, if node.transform is not explicitly specified then it is false if either xpack.transform.enabled is false or node.data is false, and true otherwise.
This complex default value can be implemented using the Setting factory method that takes a Function for the default value: 
  
    
      elasticsearch/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/common/settings/Setting.java
    
    
         Line 1264
      in
      012746d

nodes.bodyText:
In the ML plugin we ban these node attributes even when the plugin is disabled.  In other words the enabled == false check comes after the check that throws this error.  I think it's best because otherwise you can get the weird situation where somebody sets the node attribute directly when the plugin is disabled on a node and then other nodes in the cluster might assign transform persistent tasks to the node.  Such tasks wouldn't do anything because no plugin would be watching for them on the node they're assigned to.
(Of course, this is an extreme edge case and unlikely to ever happen.  It also ties in with the conversation about whether it should be permitted to disable plugins on just a subset of nodes.  Moving to a world where transforms is always enabled will simplify things a lot.)

I would use the phrase not a transform node instead of transform not enabled.  Users can see this reason and not a transform node more clearly ties the reason to the node.transform setting and the docs about transform nodes.  It's also more consistent with not a data node from line 136.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            coordinating nodes or dedicated master nodes, disable the node.ml role.
          
          
            
            coordinating nodes or dedicated master nodes, disable the node.transform role.

commit.message:
implement transform node attributes to disable transform on certain nodes
and test which nodes are allowed to do remote connections
check only for 8.0.0 until its backported
change node.transform, so that dedicated transform nodes are possible

fix NPE in usage retrieval if task state is null

fixes #48734
avoid network call to all nodes in case no tasks are running
add a note for dedicated coordinating/master nodes

Revert "avoid network call to all nodes in case no tasks are running"

This reverts commit 870e716671680714a00728ef47c838747b27540d.
